sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

3x + 2y - z = 5
2x - 4y + 7z = -8
x + y - 3z = 1

Round the solutions to 2 decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the vector of variables, and b is the vector of constants.

A = | 3  2 -1 |
    | 2 -4  7 |
    | 1  1 -3 |

b = |  5 |
    | -8 |
    |  1 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, where A = QR, and Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the columns of A:

u1 = a1 = (3, 2, 1)
e1 = u1/||u1|| = (3, 2, 1) / sqrt(14) = (3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14))

u2 = a2 - proj(a2, e1) = (2, -4, 1) - ((2, -4, 1)·e1)e1
u2 = (2, -4, 1) - (2/7)(3, 2, 1) = (1/7, -30/7, 5/7)
e2 = u2/||u2|| = (1/7, -30/7, 5/7) / sqrt(155/49) = (1/sqrt(155), -30/sqrt(155), 5/sqrt(155))

u3 = a3 - proj(a3, e1) - proj(a3, e2) = (-1, 7, -3) - ((-1, 7, -3)·e1)e1 - ((-1, 7, -3)·e2)e2
u3 = (-1, 7, -3) - (-1/7)(3, 2, 1) - (1/31)(1, -30, 5) = (0, 0, 2)
e3 = u3/||u3|| = (0, 0, 2) / 2 = (0, 0, 1)

Now we have the orthogonal basis e1, e2, and e3. We can form the matrix Q using these basis vectors as columns:

Q = |  3/sqrt(14)   1/sqrt(155)   0 |
    |  2/sqrt(14) -30/sqrt(155)   0 |
    |  1/sqrt(14)   5/sqrt(155)   1 |

Next, we find the matrix R by multiplying the transpose of Q with A:

R = Q^T * A

R = | 14/7   -2/7   -1/7 |
    |  0    155/31   5/31 |
    |  0      0       2   |

Now we have the QR decomposition of A: A = QR. We can solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = |  3/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14)   1/sqrt(14) |  |  5  |
          |  1/sqrt(155) -30/sqrt(155)  5/sqrt(155)|  | -8  |
          |      0            0            1       |  |  1  |

Q^T * b = |  5/sqrt(14)  |
          | -8/sqrt(155) |
          |      1       |

Now we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b using back substitution:

2z = 1 => z = 0.5
(155/31)y + (5/31)z = -8/sqrt(155) => y = -0.5
(14/7)x - (2/7)y - (1/7)z = 5/sqrt(14) => x = 1.5

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 1.50
y = -0.50
z = 0.50
